results.adx_keywords: Icebreakers;Appointments and Executive Changes;United States Defense and Military Forces;Gender;Fagan, Linda L;United States Coast Guard;United States Coast Guard Academy
results.title: Coast Guard Admiral to Become First Female Service Chief, Shattering Another Glass Ceiling
results.abstract: In 1985, the service had no gender-based prohibitions on where women could go. That cleared the way for Admiral Linda L. Fagan to rise to the top.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Adm. Linda L. Fagan will be the 27th commandant of the Coast Guard.

results.title: Sabrina’s Parents Love Her. But the Meltdowns Are Too Much.
results.abstract: Unpredictable violence, chaotic outbursts and countless trips to the emergency room. What happens when an autistic teenager becomes unmanageable at home?

results.title: Hepatitis A Outbreak in U.S. and Canada Linked to Strawberries
results.abstract: The F.D.A. said the likely source of the outbreak was fresh organic strawberries that were sold under the FreshKampo and H-E-B brands in March and April.

media.caption: Public health officials in the United States and Canada have identified more than two dozen cases of hepatitis A that they said might be linked to organic strawberries.

results.title: Alligator Kills Florida Man Retrieving Frisbees in Lake, Officials Say
results.abstract: The 47-year-old man frequently swam into a lake near a disc golf course to retrieve stray discs and sell them, a park official said.

media.caption: A sign warns people not to feed or disturb alligators at a lake where a Florida man was found dead in Largo, Fla.

results.title: Buffalo Shooting Suspect to Face Murder and Terrorism Charges
results.abstract: A 25-count indictment includes both first-degree murder charges and second-degree murder charges as hate crimes, as well as a single count of domestic terrorism.

media.caption: Thirteen people were shot, almost all of them Black, at a Tops supermarket in Buffalo last month.

results.title: Uvalde Teacher Spoke With Husband, a Police Officer, Before She Died
results.abstract: Eva Mireles’s husband was an officer with the school district’s Police Department. But he was not allowed to enter the place where his wife and her students were under attack.

media.caption: Eva Mireles, who taught fourth graders at Robb Elementary School, was one of 21 victims.

results.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad
results.title: Putin’s Threats Highlight the Dangers of a New, Riskier Nuclear Era
results.abstract: After generations of stability in nuclear arms control, a warning to Russia from President Biden shows how old norms are eroding.
des_facet: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

media.caption: A monument in Moscow to an early Soviet-era tactical nuclear bomb. Russia’s reminders of its nuclear might over the past three months are the latest evidence of a new era of instability in arms control.

results.title: $5.8 Billion in Loans Will Be Forgiven for Corinthian Colleges Students

results.title: Sarah Palin’s Bid for New Libel Trial Against The Times Is Denied
results.abstract: A judge ruled that Ms. Palin failed to introduce “even a speck” of evidence to prove the newspaper defamed her in a 2017 editorial that mistakenly connected her political rhetoric with a mass shooting.

results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Adam Bednar
results.title: Johnny Depp Jury Finds That Amber Heard Defamed Him in Op-Ed
results.abstract: The jury in Virginia found that Ms. Heard had damaged her ex-husband’s reputation with an op-ed in which she identified herself as a “public figure representing domestic abuse.”

media.caption: The libel case that pitted Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard lasted six weeks.

results.adx_keywords: Theater;Nudism and Nudity;Social Media;Smartphones;Williams, Jesse (1981- )
results.title: With Cameras on Every Phone, Will Broadway’s Nude Scenes Survive?
results.abstract: Audiences are increasingly asked to lock their phones in pouches at comedy shows, concerts and some plays. But what happens onstage doesn’t always stay onstage.

media.caption: Audience members lock their phones in pouches at a comedy show at the Stand in New York. But even with precautions, video clips of jokes, performances, and even nude scenes sometimes show up online.
media.copyright: Calla Kessler for The New York Times

results.title: President Biden: What America Will and Will Not Do in Ukraine
results.abstract: The U.S. will help Ukraine be in the strongest possible position at the negotiating table. We do not want to prolong the war just to inflict pain on Russia.

results.adx_keywords: Bison;Yellowstone National Park
results.title: Bison Gores a Woman Who Approached in Yellowstone National Park
results.abstract: The park said that tourists should stay clear of big animals, recommending at least 25 yards between them and bison, bighorn sheep and other types of animals.

media.caption: General view of a herd of wild bison with their newborn calves, known as “red dogs,” in Yellowstone National Park.

results.adx_keywords: Coffee;Research;Caffeine;Sugar;Diet and Nutrition;Antioxidants
results.title: Coffee Drinking Linked to Lower Risk of Dying, New Study Finds
results.abstract: The research found that those who drank moderate amounts of coffee, even with a little sugar, were up to 30 percent less likely to die during the study period than those who didn’t drink coffee.

media.copyright: Aileen Son for The New York Times
